content: dresses for calico critter and sylvanian mothers by dawn smith you will need  #10 crochet cotton  size b 2 25 mm hook  a small snap abbreviations chain - chain sts - stitches single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet decrease - single_crochet two together slip_stitch slip_stitch i am a big fan of the forward loop chain as a foundation chain it is particularly helpful here since you will be crocheting into both sides of your foundation chain i also used it for the armhole chains in row five here s a tutorial http //mrsmicawber blogspot com/2013/10/forward-loop-chain-alternative-to html pattern for dress starts here bodice chain 26 - if you do as i do and use the forward loop chain do 25 of those and one regular chain row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across chain 1 turn 25 single_crochet row 2 single_crochet in first 6 scs ch6 skip 1 single_crochet single_crochet in next 11 scs ch6 skip 1 single_crochet single_crochet in last 6 scs chain 1 turn 35 sts - 23 single_crochet and 12 chain row 3 decrease single_crochet in each st across including in each chain decrease chain 1 turn 33 single_crochet for an alternate version of row 3 if you don t like crocheting into chains you can sc6 into the space left by the chains in row 2 row 4 sc7 decrease twice sc3 decrease sc2 decrease sc3 decrease twice sc6 27 single_crochet slip_stitch down the side to the beginning chain 4 sts - you can either do this or break the thread after row 4 and start with new thread at row 5 i don t like weaving in ends so i do the former if i m using a solid color for the dress skirt row 5 you will be crocheting into the foundation chain at the waist 2 single_crochet in each stitch across ch2 turn 50 single_crochet now work in rounds round 6 double_crochet to end of row join in the top of the first double_crochet ch2 round 7 double_crochet to end of row join in the top of the first double_crochet ch1 round 8 - scalloped hem 1 single_crochet 2 double_crochet in the first st skip the next st across finish off 1 finishing weave in all ends sew on a small snap to close the bodice variations * for the contrast color at the waist do a surface slip_stitch in the waist stitches where the bodice joins the skirt if you started with a forward loop chain the stitches at the waist will have little openings * for the three color version i did the above scalloped hem in the back loops only here is a surface slip_stitch tutorial if you don t have this in your repertoire https //www supergurumi com/crochet-surface-slip-stitches pattern for bib dress starts here the pattern is basically the same as for version 1 up to the bib portion it just has the color changes listed mc = skirt and bib
